lines.text: Roar!
How come it's my responsibility?
Because.
Oh. OK, now I understand; all you had to do was explain it. I take out the garbage... because.
C'mon, you big overgrown goldfish, come to Jake!
I want you, to get out of the water.
What?
I want you, to get out of that terrible job!
C'mon Mom, you can't be serious.
Damn! I'm serious.
Dad died of a heart attack!
No. He died from fear. The fear of it killed him.

[when the shark chases him through tunnels]
JESUS CHRIST!

[as the shark swims up to him]
Oh, shit.

[to the shark]
Come and get me, you son of a bitch!

[to torch-wielding welder wife Carla]
I've always wanted to make love to an angry welder. I've dreamed of nothing else since I was a small boy.

[to Michael and his crewmates]
If mediocrity were fat, you'd all be whales!
I have an irresistible urge to kiss you, Ellen Brody.
Why?
Because... it would not occur to you why.
If I go any faster this thing will turn into a flying Cuisinart and we'll all be diced into oblivion!

[last lines, as he is leaving]
When I get back, remind to tell you about the time I took 100 nuns to Nairobi!
fate or circumstance? What you are about to see concerns such an event. Maybe you can determine whether we are dealing here, with circumstances, or fate.
